Content.Title: All Singing All Dancing...
Content.Synopsis: ... All New Year's Night: Stuart Maconie, himself a Wigan lad and patron of the Casino's famous all nighters, welcomes in the New Year with a selection of Northern soul classics.

Content.Title: Mo Dutta
Content.Synopsis: Mo's magical music mix plus the usual banter make early mornings the best time of your day! Includes Pause for Thought.

Content.Title: Good Morning Sunday
Content.Synopsis: Says Good Morning Sunday for the last time, and looks back at his past 15 years on the programme, recalling interviews with famous guests.

Content.Title: Sunday Love Songs
Content.Synopsis: Lulu sits in for Steve Wright and presents a blend of classic love songs, dedications and real-life romance stories.

Content.Title: Parkinson's Sunday Supplement
Content.Synopsis: Michael Parkinson delivers his End of Year Review, recalling his most memorable moments from the last 12 months. His guests include radio critic Gillian Reynolds, and broadcaster Quentin Cooper.

Content.Title: Elaine Paige on Sunday
Content.Synopsis: A themed instalment showcasing Hollywood's top songs, with classics from The Wizard of Oz, Casablanca and Breakfast at Tiffany's.

Content.Title: Russell Davies
Content.Synopsis: Russell Davies examines the career of songwriter Jule Styne, whose birth centenary fell yesterday.

Content.Title: Pick of the Pops
Content.Synopsis: Dale Winton looks at the chart from this week in 1966, with music from Gene Pitney, Fontella Bass, The Walker Brothers and Sandie Shaw.

Content.Title: Alan Titchmarsh
Content.Synopsis: Alan presents a special New Year programme and plays an eclectic mix of music from the worlds of classical, musicals, film and jazz.

Content.Title: From Mile End to Manhattan
Content.Synopsis: The Making of Jule Styne: Don Black examines the career of composer Jule Styne, who emigrated from London's East End to America at the age of eight and went on to conquer Broadway and Hollywood.

Content.Title: Sunday Half Hour
Content.Synopsis: All Things New: Roger Royle looks forward to the coming year with hymns of thanksgiving and hope celebrating all things new.

Content.Title: Your 100 Best Tunes
Content.Synopsis: Richard Baker presents a selection of your favourite popular classics.

Content.Title: Malcolm Laycock
Content.Synopsis: Celebrating the age of swing with music from the dance bands and big bands of Britain and America.

Content.Title: The David Jacobs Collection
Content.Synopsis: The best in easy listening music, plus album reviews and Our Kind of Music.
